Cheatcode.description: Specification of a single cheatcode. Extends [`Function`] with additional metadata.

group.description: The group that the cheatcode belongs to.

safety.description: Whether the cheatcode is safe to use inside of scripts. E.g. it does not change state in an unexpected way.

status.description: The current status of the cheatcode. E.g. whether it is stable or experimental, etc.

description.description: The description of the enum. This is a markdown string derived from the NatSpec documentation.
The description of the variant. This is a markdown string derived from the NatSpec documentation.

declaration.description: The Solidity error declaration, including full type, parameter names, etc.

description.description: The description of the error. This is a markdown string derived from the NatSpec documentation.

declaration.description: The Solidity event declaration, including full type, parameter names, etc.

description.description: The description of the event. This is a markdown string derived from the NatSpec documentation.

declaration.description: The Solidity function declaration, including full type and parameter names, visibility, etc.

description.description: The description of the function. This is a markdown string derived from the NatSpec documentation.

id.description: The function's unique identifier. This is the function name, optionally appended with an index if it is overloaded.

mutability.description: The Solidity function state mutability attribute.

selector.description: The hex-encoded, "0x"-prefixed 4-byte function selector, which is the Keccak-256 hash of `signature`.

selectorBytes.description: The 4-byte function selector as a byte array.

signature.description:
The standard function signature used to calculate `selector`. See the [Solidity docs] for more information.

[Solidity docs]: https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/abi-spec.html#function-selector

visibility.description: The Solidity function visibility attribute. This is currently always `external`, but this may change in the future.

Group.description:
Cheatcode groups. Initially derived and modified from inline comments in [`forge-std`'s `Vm.sol`][vmsol].

[vmsol]: https://github.com/foundry-rs/forge-std/blob/dcb0d52bc4399d37a6545848e3b8f9d03c77b98d/src/Vm.sol

oneOf.description:
Cheatcodes that read from, or write to the current EVM execution state.

Examples: any of the `record` cheatcodes, `chainId`, `coinbase`.

Safety: ambiguous, depends on whether the cheatcode is read-only or not.

Cheatcodes that interact with how a test is run.

Examples: `assume`, `skip`, `expectRevert`.

Safety: ambiguous, depends on whether the cheatcode is read-only or not.

Cheatcodes that interact with how a script is run.

Examples: `broadcast`, `startBroadcast`, `stopBroadcast`.

Safety: safe.

Cheatcodes that interact with the OS or filesystem.

Examples: `ffi`, `projectRoot`, `writeFile`.

Safety: safe.

Cheatcodes that interact with the program's environment variables.

Examples: `setEnv`, `envBool`, `envOr`.

Safety: safe.

Utility cheatcodes that deal with string parsing and manipulation.

Examples: `toString`. `parseBytes`.

Safety: safe.

Utility cheatcodes that deal with parsing values from and converting values to JSON.

Examples: `serializeJson`, `parseJsonUint`, `writeJson`.

Safety: safe.

Utility cheatcodes that deal with parsing values from and converting values to TOML.

Examples: `parseToml`, `writeToml`.

Safety: safe.

Cryptography-related cheatcodes.

Examples: `sign*`.

Safety: safe.

Generic, uncategorized utilities.

Examples: `toString`, `parse*`, `serialize*`.

Safety: safe.

Mutability.description:
Solidity function state mutability attribute. See the [Solidity docs] for more information.

[Solidity docs]: https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/contracts.html#state-mutability

oneOf.description: Disallows modification or access of state.
Disallows modification of state.
Allows modification of state.
The cheatcode is not safe to use in scripts.
The cheatcode is safe to use in scripts.
The cheatcode and its API is currently stable.

The cheatcode is unstable, meaning it may contain bugs and may break its API on any release.

Use of experimental cheatcodes will result in a warning.

The cheatcode has been deprecated, meaning it will be removed in a future release.

Contains the optional reason for deprecation.

Use of deprecated cheatcodes is discouraged and will result in a warning.

The cheatcode has been removed and is no longer available for use.

Use of removed cheatcodes will result in a hard error.

The cheatcode is only used internally for foundry testing and may be changed or removed at any time.

Use of internal cheatcodes is discouraged and will result in a warning.

description.description: The description of the struct. This is a markdown string derived from the NatSpec documentation.
The description of the field. This is a markdown string derived from the NatSpec documentation.

Visibility.description:
Solidity function visibility attribute. See the [Solidity docs] for more information.

[Solidity docs]: https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/contracts.html#function-visibility

oneOf.description: The function is only visible externally.
Visible externally and internally.
Only visible internally.
Only visible in the current contract
